# waitUntilExit()

**Instance Method**

Blocks the process until the receiver is finished.

## Declaration

```swift
func waitUntilExit()
```

## Discussion

This method first checks to see if the receiver is still running using [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Process/isRunning]. Then it polls the current run loop using `NSDefaultRunLoopMode` until the task completes.



[doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Process/waitUntilExit()] does not guarantee that the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Process/terminationHandler] block has been fully executed before [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Process/waitUntilExit()] returns.

## Related Documentation

- **launch()**: Launches the task represented by the receiver.

## Running and Stopping

- **run()**: Runs the process with the current environment.
- **interrupt()**: Sends an interrupt signal to the receiver and all of its subtasks.
- **resume()**: Resumes execution of a suspended task.
- **suspend()**: Suspends execution of the receiver task.
- **terminate()**: Sends a terminate signal to the receiver and all of its subtasks.
